title: World Travel Awards reveals host for Grand Final 2015
text:
World Travel Awards reveals host for Grand Final 2015 
London, 6th July 2015 
Mazagan Beach & Golf Resort in El Jadida, Morocco, has been unveiled as host of the World Travel Awards Grand Final Gala Ceremony 2015. 
Hundreds of industry leaders will gather in the world-leading destination on December 12th, 2015, as World Travel Awards presents its coveted global titles. 
Tourism operators in Morocco are expected to enjoy a boost in their global exposure given the attention World Travel Awards commands. 
The announcement was made by World Travel Awards president Graham Cooke, Moroccan minister of tourism, His Excellency Dr. Lahcen Haddad, Mazagan Beach & Golf Resort president Stephan Killinger and Mohammed Arkobi, chairman of Innovate Marketing Solutions, during a press conference earlier. 
Speaking at the event World Travel Awards president Graham Cooke said: “This is a momentous day for World Travel Awards and for the Moroccan tourism industry. Morocco is the ideal destination for World Travel Awards; growing rapidly to become the leading tourism destination in the region. 
“There is so much to offer, from the beaches of Agadir, to the splendour of the Atlas Mountains and the cosmopolitan chic of downtown Rabat. Leader among them all is Mazagan Beach & Golf Resort where we will be delighted to stage our Grand Final in December this year.” 
The five-star Mazagan Beach & Golf Resort is located in El Jadida. 
Home to an industry leading spa, the largest casino in Morocco, a host of delicious restaurants, a vast range of luxury accommodation and one of the best golf courses in the region, it is the perfect location for the World Travel Awards Grand Final Gala Ceremony. 
The World Travel Awards Grand Final 2015 will follow a series of regional Gala Ceremonies, with events this year scheduled for Forte Village (Sardinia, Italy), Bogotá (Colombia), Raffles Hotel (Singapore), and Beaches Turks & Caicos in the Caribbean. 
The Grand Tour 2015 kicked off with the Middle East ceremony at Four Seasons Resort Dubai at Jumeriah Beach in May, with Seychelles welcoming the Africa & Indian Ocean Gala Ceremony earlier this month. 
World Travel Awards was established in 1993 to acknowledge, reward and celebrate excellence across all sectors of the tourism industry. 
Today, the WTA brand is recognised globally as the ultimate hallmark of quality, with winners setting the benchmark to which all others aspire. Notes to Editors 
Photo caption: left to right, back row: Innovate Marketing Solutions vice president Khaled Yamak, Morocco tourism minister His Excellency Dr. Lahcen Haddad and World Travel Awards president Graham Cooke. 
Left to right, front row: Mohammed Arkobi, chairman of Innovate Marketing Solutions and Mazagan Beach & Golf Resort president Stephan Killinger. 
World Travel Awards celebrates its 22nd anniversary this year and is acknowledged across the globe as the ultimate travel accolade. 
The brand aims to celebrate those organisations that are pushing the boundaries of industry excellence. 
WTA’s global media partner network includes International New York Times, TV5Monde, CNBC Arabiya, Outlook Traveller, Travel & Leisure, Khaleej Times, Trade Arabia, TTN, Best in Travel, Trav Talk India, Publituris, ASTA Network, Breaking Travel News, Travel Daily News International and Focus on Travel News. 
World Travel Awards has a television audience of 300 million spread across 200 countries, while also reaching hundreds of thousands of print and digital readers each month through an extensive network of global media partners.
